iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Community Development Project - Herat, Kushk
iati-activity.description: Objective is to enable the rural communities with skills and capacity to improve their own well being, utilize their resources and meet the needs of the most vulnerable groups of communities. Selected communities are trained in community development practices.
iati-activity.sector: Multisector aid for basic social services

iati-activity.title: Administrative cost of MFA missions abroad for AFGHANISTAN
iati-activity.description: Administrative cost of MFA missions abroad for AFGHANISTAN. Costs generated from the Embassy of Finland

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Livelihood Development for Self-Employment and Job Creation
iati-activity.description: The aim of the project is to enhance the legal_ socio-economic and political status of women as entrepreneurs and producers in their communities through lobbying and advocacy by women economic networks. During the project there will be establised the networks that can link rural women economic advocates and women economic groups with decision makers at local and national levels.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Training of women journalists
iati-activity.description: The aim of the project is to organise additional professional education for the women journalists in Afghanistan and to form mentoring pairs between the women journalists in Afghnistan and Finland. The education will contain special courses of journalism_ ethical rules_ the role of the media in developing democracy and women_s rights. The idea is also to give a possibility to few afghan women journalists to get to know the activities of the Finnish media houses.
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Health and Care in the Community. To improve the lives and the general health and sanitation conditions of vulnerable communities through the promotion of the community based health care and water and sanitation activities.

iati-activity.title: Support to the training of police and prosecutors (CMC)
iati-activity.description: The Advanced Police-Prosecutor Coordination Training Programme - Pilot Phase of the Long-term Rule of Law Support to the Government of Afghanistan.

Developing the capacity of the headquarters of the partner organization in supporting the regional bases in the area of logistics and ITC.

iati-activity.title: Polioeradication Initiative
iati-activity.description: The Polio Eradication Initiative started in Afghanistan in l994. Now, the overall objective of the initiative is to interrupt there the wild poliovirus transmission. The specific objective of the project is to immunize over 95% of the targeted 7.9 million children in each round of National immunization days and 95% of 3.6 million children in each round of Sub-national immunization days.
iati-activity.participating-org: Finnish NGO, Suomen Rotary ry-Finlands Rotary rf

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Afghanistan
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Afghanistan
iati-activity.description: Continuation of a project of 2009. The main goal of the shelter/project is to ensure the realization of the human rights of the customers (women). Finnish funding covers psychological support, legal aid and arbitration support for women and girls that have faced serious human rights violations (rape, domestic violence, forced marriage, threat of honor killing) The shelter offers room and board and educational services for the customers.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Afghanistan
iati-activity.description: General civic education of voters, capacity building and campaign training for female candidates and training in parliamentary democracy for new parliamentarians

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Afghanistan
iati-activity.description: 4 week intensive music academy with students from vulnerable groups, such as street children, includes english classes as well.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Afghanistan
iati-activity.description: Remedial Education Programme (expansion to four northern provinces). For the funding period of one year, 1050 female students and 700 male students will be provided with remedial education programs in four provinces (Sar-i-Pol, Balkh, Samangan and Jawzjan

iati-activity.title: Serve Community Based Rehabilitation with People with Disablilities
iati-activity.description: The Community Based Rehabilitation with People with Disabilities (PwDs) aims to empower communities and families of individuals with disabilities for inclusion od PwDs in all aspects of life through 1)CBR including Home Based Training, vocational training and loan programs 2) Advocacy and disability awarness 3) Advocacy and capacity building of government

iati-activity.title: Support to Parliamentary Elections and Reintegration Trust Fund in
iati-activity.description: To support the parliamentary elections in Afghanistan 2010 through the election fund and also the reintegration trust fund both run by UNDP.

iati-activity.title: Women Human Rights Club
iati-activity.description: A series of training organized as discussions and workshops is an open forum to raise awareness and find ways to promote and protect the rights of women in Afghanistan, as the weak status of women and violations of their human rights, especially violence against them belong to the most flagrant and widely spread problems in the sphere of human rights.

iati-activity.title: Supporting subnational approaches of political reintegration in Afghanistan
iati-activity.description: This project is built on the assumption that financial incentives are insufficient in themselves and that there need to be other political incentives as well. The specific objectives of the project are to identify such incentives for insurgents to reintegrate; how these processes could be supported by externally facilitated dialogue; and whether sub-national governance or traditional tribal structures could be utilized to that end. Based on analysis and lessons-learned, and detailed work plan will be defined with possible approaches how to support local reintegration initiatives.

iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations (UNDPKO)
